overview_metadata.overview_subtitle: Point of Intersection of Linear Graphs
overview_metadata.overview_description: In this lesson, students investigate the relationship between cost and income in a context. They write two equations, create a table, graph the lines, interpret the intersection as the break-even point, and make sense of values on both sides of the intersection point. Students verify their solution by substituting the intersection point in both equations. They apply these strategies in another context.

overview_item_data_items: I can interpret the solution to a system of two linear equations in two variables as the point of intersection of two linear graphs and in terms of the original problem context.
I can determine a point of intersection in a system of linear equations using tables.
I can analyze and solve a system of simultaneous linear equations graphically.
I can write a system of equations to represent a problem situation.
The point of intersection is the point where two lines cross on a coordinate plane.
The point of intersection is the ordered pair that represents a solution to both equations represented by the graphs.
When one line represents an item's cost and the other line represents the income from selling the item, you can call the point of intersection the break-even point.
You can identify a point of intersection from a graph, table, or equation.

overview_item_data_group_items.overview_item_data_group_item_descriptio: Students consider a situation and share recommendations on how much to charge for an item.

overview_item_data_group_items.overview_item_data_group_item_title: Graphing and Interpreting a Point of Intersection
overview_item_data_group_items.overview_item_data_group_item_descriptio: Students write equations, create a table, and graph a situation to interpret the point of intersection.
Students investigate how modifying the original situation affects the break-even point.

overview_item_data_group_items.overview_item_data_group_item_title: Determining a Point of Intersection to Solve a Problem
overview_item_data_group_items.overview_item_data_group_item_descriptio: Students write and graph two equations to model a situation and interpret the point of intersection.

overview_item_data_group_items.overview_item_data_group_item_title: Putting It All on the Table
overview_item_data_group_items.overview_item_data_group_item_descriptio: Students explain how to determine the point of intersection from a table.

overview_item_data_items: To avoid printing additional materials not included in MATHbook (like Activate activities and Session Quick Checks) project them using the Present button above.
